comments.body: That could be a cute idea but I don't really see the point since it wouldn't work so well in Minecraft.
Instead of water, what about arrows??????!!   ARCHERfish!!!!!
This is a really cool idea

I feel like each one would have a specific use (besides a guardian) such as: Fire Elementals being similar to the strider, with more health, and no need for warped fungus on a stick. Water Elementals being a water mount, obviously moving faster than the average sprint swim (even with dolphin’s grace) Earth Elementals could possibly be a mobile base by building atop their back, and some sort of shockwave attack, or instead of a mobile base, just move faster than horses. Wind Elementals could (obviously) fly, slower than an elytra (for balance and not make the elytra pointless) Dark Elementals could possibly fly as well but have the ability not to fall into the void, and be slower (slightly) than the elytra. Ice Elementals maybe could freeze mobs? And have the frostwalker effect? Not sure what they could do.

These were just my “quick” ramblings, had this idea for a while.
Interesting. :D

This is a good idea just that you what would the color the ore be?And if this update comes shouldn't we find the specific elemental power in the rocks which are located in the specific biomes you were talking about?And add energy and golden power.

This would be amazing; especially with possibly adding orangutans! They are an endangered species due to unsustainable palm oil harvesting, but not many people are aware. Since Minecraft has started to add pandas and future axolotls, this could be a good addition to the strategy. Hence, many kids who play this game learned about obsidian and how it takes form; perhaps they could learn other important subjects too.

I honestly think chimpanzees and gorillas should be added, they could both be added because you could tell the difference because of size and what their faces looked like. The gorillas should have attack technique and strength similar to an iron golem, and stand up on their hind legs when they attack, and the chimps should have attack strength similar to wolves, and they should also stand on their hind legs when they attack or jump at the enemy. This would be so cool to see in minecraft!!!

Iron Golems shouldn't be able to ride on Iron Horses. That has too much weight.
maybe if you use more iron to make it bigger than iron golems can ride it.
I feel like the Iron Golem can't ride any creature just because of it's size and weight but I wish you luck on your post my friend.
You could ride it and have the ability to ram mobs dealing heavy damage, the only downside is that it rust in water, if it falls into water, it will get slower and eventually die.
The insomnia doesn't go away until the player sleeps and not from a mobs death.
What's the point of this mob?
What's the item?
I don't even notice phantoms until they hit me so I would sure hope this doesn't have too much health or at least gives a bunch of phantom membranes

Well this dose sound like an interesting way to encounter a boss, but what's the bose like? And what dose it give?

I'd think an item useable to make a sort of phantom repellent without sleeping would be appropriate for this
What does it drop?

there could also be medium warrior phantoms that spawn before the boss does, so it is like phantoms are trying to enforce sleep rather than just attracted to insomniacs.

The item could be a phantom cloak that gives the player slow falling for 2 seconds as well as having natural feather falling. Depending on the difficulty of the boss, it could make phantoms and ghasts neutral, and be worn on the head slot (it is a hooded cloak) so you could use both it and the elytra at the same time.

When you are falling it would flare out so it looks really cool (like your suspended in the air or something) and the elytra would render attached to the cloak rather than your back. Other armor could render under the cloak.

it would be crafted from a special drop of the phantom boss, (like phantom bones) phantom membrane, and leather. Phantom bones would also be used in crafting in the elytra, but you would need a larger quantity of phantom bones, meaning you would need to fight the boss multiple times. It could also require a rare drop of the phantom boss, like "complete membrane" or something(1 in 10 chance or something)
I do agree with this, it should probably be a feature, it just makes sense
Sounds like a great idea!

Yeah because my villagers iron golems prioritize me over the zombies eating the villagers because I accidentally punched a villager. They will literally follow you until you are dead even if they have to leave the village
i heard that if you go far enough the iron golem forgives

I agree with this, It would make raids a lot more intresting because you cant cheese them with a few blocks of dirt

 

Maybe even add a special pillager that does this inestead, or let them build over them!

To do this, a special action will need to be added called charge. It will break weak blocks, like dirt and maybe cobblestone, but leave obsidian and other strong blocks (eg blocks of iron). It would also leave most game generated blocks, so it might destroy a wall or two, but entire houses wouldn’t be destroyed.

Maybe even add multiple ways for raids to overcome obstacles? 

Ravagers could destroy a few blocks at a time with a charge.
A new Pillager could be build scaffolding towers or ladders.
Maybe if playing on hard, that new Pillager could carry small dynamite charges of some sort that allows it to break walls.

And of course in general: Enable the raids to roughly find the weakest part of a wall in a certain radius maybe?
